docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Stigma, not fear of runaway costs, is what allows insurance companies and employers to block mental health insurance from attaining true parity with medical and surgical coverage (editorial, May 1). Biased, mistaken beliefs that mental illness is merely weakness, that mentally ill people could improve if they really wanted to and that the mentally ill simply bring their condition upon themselves are what fuel this inequality in insurance coverage.
docs.abstract: Letter from Dr Kenneth R Silk (American Psychiatric Association) on May 1 editorial holds stigma of mental illness, not fear of runaway costs, allows insurance companies and employers to block mental health insurance from reaching parity with medical coverage
